body: Concept ACK. Thanks for picking this up. Will review now that the requested changes are in.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#22981](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22981) (doc: Fix incorrect C++ named args by MarcoFalke)
* [#22924](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22924) (refactor: cleanup/followup of Remove -deprecatedrpc=addresses flag by mjdietzx)
* [#22564](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22564) ([WIP] refactor: Move mutable globals cleared in `::UnloadBlockIndex` to `BlockManager` by dongcarl)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Concept ACK, this is a useful feature to have, an interesting approach to use the undo data.

   were previously deprecated in 22.0. (#22650)

body: Thank you. I would like to address that a next rebase or in a follow-up PR.

3cc95345ca49b87e8caca9a0e6418c63ae1e463a

nit, add `break;`?

51dbc167e98daab317baa80cf80bfda337672dab

nit, we only care about one value, what's wrong with
```cpp
if (verbosity == TxVerbosity::SHOW_DETAILS_AND_PREVOUT) {
```
If you do this, then declare `prev_coin` in the inner scope.
Thank you. I would like to address that a next rebase or in a follow-up PR.
I have actually proposed the same in the original PR: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21245#discussion_r630497819
@MarcoFalke Should I address the review comments now (and thus invalidate ACKs) or can I do it in a follow-up PR? I mean can the PR be merged?

Merged this as there were no critical comments, many ACKs, and to not drag this on forever. I do think in general it's better to just incorporate comments and not move small nits 'to follow-up PRs' because of fear of invalidating ACKs.

> I do think in general it's better to just incorporate comments and not move small nits 'to follow-up PRs' because of fear of invalidating ACKs.

I agree. The point of PR review (among other things) is to get code to a mergable state. There are trade-offs depending on the size/complexity of a change, and whether or not everything _must_ be addressed, but I think we have started to drift too far to the wrong side of pushing changes to followups / not actually taking review suggestions onboard for fear of *invalidating ACKs* (not saying that is the case here).

Post merge ACK 5c34507ecbbdc29c086276d1c62835b461823507

Did some review and light testing while rebasing #22924
